info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 6 at 8:31AM CDT until May 6 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Mason and San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Sloan, Pontotoc, Skeeterville, Chappel, Fredonia, Elm Grove, Hall, Harkeyville, Spring Creek, Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line, Locker and Us-190 Near The San Saba-Lampasas County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, CR 424 crossing Rough Creek, CR 208 crossing San Saba River, Spy Rock crossing, Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Old Pontotoc crossing Little Willow Creek, Old Union crossing and Hickory Grove crossing Elm Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING
